detail.default_paragraph_1: This design pattern guides users to interact more effectively with AI by providing intuitive interface feedback.

Give users clues about how to interact w: Give users clues about how to interact with the model, particularly when getting started.
Get more information from the user when: Get more information from the user when the initial prompt isn't sufficiently clear
follow_up.desc_1: In an ideal scenario, the user is so good at prompting that they can reach a great outcome on their first try. In reality, that's often not the case. Follow ups are prompts, questions, or inline actions that help users refine or extend their initial interaction with the model so the model can better understand their intent.
follow_up.desc_2: A well-timed follow up saves compute cycles, prevents wasted effort, and communicates that the AI is working alongside the user rather than starting over.
Large, open-ended input inviting the use: Large, open-ended input inviting the user to start their first interaction with the AI
initial_cta.desc_1: For many products, the first touchpoint with AI is through the Initial CTA: A prominent collection of inputs and actions that allow a user to start prompting. From here, the user works with the model through regenerations, variants, and other actions in order to reach their intended goal.
initial_cta.desc_2: The most common implementation of this pattern is a large direct input box, where the system goal is to understand the user’s context and intent as quickly as possible while minimizing the amount of work they have to do to express it. The implementation of this pattern varies depending on the context and capabilities of the surrounding application.
Alert users to actions they can take to: Alert users to actions they can take to use AI, especially if they are just getting started
Solves the blank canvas dilemma with clu: Solves the blank canvas dilemma with clues for how to prompt
Structured templates that can be filled: Structured templates that can be filled by the user or pre-filled by the AI
Submit the user's prompt to the AI withi: Submit the user's prompt to the AI within its surrounding context
Makes it easy for users to extend a prom: Makes it easy for users to extend a prompt to multiple inputs at once
Ask or interact with AI contextually bas: Ask or interact with AI contextually based on something already available on the page
Repeatedly run generative tasks without: Repeatedly run generative tasks without compromising on the format or accuracy
Open ended prompt inputs that can be use: Open ended prompt inputs that can be used in AI conversations and other natural language prompting
Use existing content as the starting poi: Use existing content as the starting point for prompting
Transfer styles without changing the und: Transfer styles without changing the underlying structure of a generation
Have AI distill a topic or resource down: Have AI distill a topic or resource down to its essence
Distill or reorganize complicated inform: Distill or reorganize complicated information into simple structure
Construct a prompt with raw tokens, just: Construct a prompt with raw tokens, just like building with legos
Use AI to change the modality of content: Use AI to change the modality of content
Let users refine or remix their prompt t: Let users refine or remix their prompt to get improved results
Give the AI a specific reference to anch: Give the AI a specific reference to anchor its response
Constrain the inputs or the outputs of t: Constrain the inputs or the outputs of the AI by source, type, modality, etc
Target specific areas of the AI's result: Target specific areas of the AI's result to regenerate or remix
Let users specify what model to use for: Let users specify what model to use for their prompts
Include constraints with your prompt for: Include constraints with your prompt for the AI to reference when generating its result
Ensure outputs match your voice, tone, a: Ensure outputs match your voice, tone, and preferences in a consistent way
See and manage what additional sources t: See and manage what additional sources the AI references to generate its response
String generative steps together to synt: String generative steps together to synthesize, create, or send content on auto-pilot
Maintain user agency as the AI works in: Maintain user agency as the AI works in order to understand and direct the AI's logic
Give the AI a specific reference to anch: Give the AI a specific reference to anchor its response
Manage the flow of information or pause: Manage the flow of information or pause a request mid-stream to adjust the prompt
Let users trace the AI's steps from prom: Let users trace the AI's steps from prompt to result
Have the AI show the steps it will take: Have the AI show the steps it will take to respond to the user's prompt before it executes its response
Show users what is actually happening be: Show users what is actually happening behind the scenes
Have the AI reproduce its response to th: Have the AI reproduce its response to the prompt without additional input
Confirm the user's intent for complicate: Confirm the user's intent for complicated prompts
Reveal the tokens the AI used to craft i: Reveal the tokens the AI used to craft its response
Trace through multiple variations of a r: Trace through multiple variations of a result to choose the one that works best for them
Give users confidence that the AI's resu: Give users confidence that the AI's results are ethical, accurate, and trustworthy
Only capture data from others with their: Only capture data from others with their knowledge and permission
Identifiers on AI Generative content tha: Identifiers on AI Generative content that humans, software, or programs can read
Control what details the AI knows about: Control what details the AI knows about you
Interact with the AI without leaving any: Interact with the AI without leaving any traces
Potentially nefarious, but certainly amb: Potentially nefarious, but certainly ambiguous patterns that impact user trust with questionable user value
Inform users about shortcomings or risks: Inform users about shortcomings or risks in the model or the technology overall
Signal expectation gaps or errors in the: Signal expectation gaps or errors in the model – but is that clear to the user?
Control how the model remembers and uses: Control how the model remembers and uses your data
Differentiate the AI from other features: Differentiate the AI from other features and highlight its use case
Visual cues to help users identify AI fe: Visual cues to help users identify AI features or content
Clearly mark content and interactions gu: Clearly mark content and interactions guided or delivered by AI
Disclosure.desc_1: The core of disclosure lies in transparency.
Name: Name
How do we refer to the AI?: How do we refer to the AI?
Characteristics that distinguish the AI': Characteristics that distinguish the AI's personality and vibe
